thread.title: Former Nottingham High School player Nate Knight announces college choice
thread.title_full: Former Nottingham High School player Nate Knight announces college choice | syracuse.com

author: Mike Waters | mwaters@syracuse.com
title: Former Nottingham High School player Nate Knight announces college choice
text:
Syracuse, N.Y. â€” Nate Knight, the former Nottingham High School basketball standout, has accepted a scholarship offer from the College of William & Mary, according to his AAU coach.
Knight, a 6-foot-8 forward, is currently attending Kimball Union Academy in Meriden, N.H.
He visited William & Mary last weekend and made his decision earlier this week. Billy Edelin, the coach of the Syracuse-based Gym Ratz AAU program, confirmed Knight's decision.
Knight decided to go to the New England prep school last May to improve his game and help him prepare academically for college.
The All-Central New York selection averaged 14.1 points and 7.4 rebounds as a senior at Notthingham last season.
Knight also held scholarship offers from almost 20 schools including Temple, Duquesne, George Mason and Canisius.
